Class MoveUtils

java.lang.Object
engine.forBoard.MoveUtils
public class MoveUtils extends Object
The MoveUtils class is a utility class that provides various helper methods related to chess moves and calculations. It serves as a collection of static utilities for move management, evaluation, and handling special move cases such as null moves. The class also provides utilities for managing coordinate lines in move generation.

This class follows the singleton pattern with a public Instance field to ensure consistent global access to its functionality throughout the chess engine.

Author:
Aaron Ho

  • Field Details

    • Instance

      public static final MoveUtils Instance
      An instance of the MoveUtils class that can be used to access its methods. This field provides global access to the utility functionality while maintaining singleton behavior.

    • NULL_MOVE

      public static final Move NULL_MOVE
      A special move representing a lack of valid move, used to signify an invalid or non-existent move. This constant serves as a null object pattern implementation for moves, allowing code to avoid null checks when dealing with potentially absent moves.

  • Constructor Details

      public MoveUtils()

  • Method Details

    • exchangeScore

      public static int exchangeScore(Move move)
      Computes the exchange score of a given move, indicating the relative value of pieces involved in the move. Higher exchange scores suggest advantageous exchanges for the player. This method recursively evaluates the sequence of captures that could follow from the initial move.
      Parameters:
      move - The move for which the exchange score is calculated.
      Returns:
      The computed exchange score for the move.
